intro: Cryptocarpha tribuloides, commonly known as the narrowleaf cryptocarpha, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It is often found in the central and eastern United States, where it thrives in full sun. Due to its delicate appearance and ecological role, it is sometimes considered a rare or endangered species in certain regions.
